pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.5: “Are you all here” renders _samaggāttha_, literally, “are you united”. Sp 2.149: _Samaggātthāti sabbā āgatatthāti attho_, “Are you united: the meaning is ‘Have you all come?’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:2.3.4: That _osāreti_ must mean “recite” can be seen from [pli-tv-bu-vb-pc4:2.3.5]() where there is no offense if _osārentaṁ opāteti_, “he prompts one who is _osārentaṁ_.” The difference between _uddesaṁ deti_ and _osāreti_ is not clear to me.
